org.kiji.schema.layout
Class TableLayoutBuilder

java.lang.Object
  org.kiji.schema.layout.TableLayoutBuilder

@ApiAudience.Private
public final class TableLayoutBuilder
extends Object

An experimental table layout builder class. Currently manipulates reader, writer, and written schemas.

Normalizes table layout descriptors with schema IDs only instead of JSON descriptions.

Nested Class Summary
static class TableLayoutBuilder.LayoutOptions
          Options to normalize table layout descriptors.

Constructor Detail

TableLayoutBuilder

public TableLayoutBuilder(KijiSchemaTable schemaTable)
                   throws IOException
Initializes a layout builder with no reference layout.

Parameters:
schemaTable - Table to resolve Avro schemas.
Throws:
IOException - on I/O error.

TableLayoutBuilder

public TableLayoutBuilder(TableLayoutDesc tableLayoutDesc,
                          Kiji kiji)
                   throws IOException
Initializes a new layout builder from an existing reference layout.

Automatically sets a new layout ID computed from the reference layout ID. Normalizes Avro schemas to use schema UIDs only.

Parameters:
tableLayoutDesc - to build with
kiji - the instance in which to configure schemas
Throws:
IOException - on I/O error. In particular, throws InvalidLayoutException if validation is not supported.
Method Detail

getRegisteredSchemas

public Collection<org.apache.avro.Schema> getRegisteredSchemas(KijiColumnName columnName,
                                                               org.kiji.schema.layout.TableLayoutBuilder.SchemaRegistrationType schemaRegistrationType)
                                                        throws IOException
List (READER | WRITER | WRITTEN) schemas registered at a column.

Parameters:
columnName - whose schemas to list.
schemaRegistrationType - of the schemas to list: (READER, WRITER, WRITTEN).
Returns:
The list of schemas. Returns empty list if schema validation was not previously enabled.
Throws:
IOException - if the cellSchema of the column can not be acquired.

withAvroValidationPolicy

public TableLayoutBuilder withAvroValidationPolicy(KijiColumnName column,
                                                   AvroValidationPolicy policy)
                                            throws NoSuchColumnException,
                                                   InvalidLayoutException
Set the Avro validation policy for a given column in this table.

Parameters:
column - the column whose Avro validation policy will be set.
policy - the AvroValidationPolicy to set for the given column.
Returns:
this builder.
Throws:
InvalidLayoutException - in case a fully qualified column in a map family is specified.
NoSuchColumnException - in case the specified column does not exist.

getAvroValidationPolicy

public AvroValidationPolicy getAvroValidationPolicy(KijiColumnName column)
                                             throws NoSuchColumnException,
                                                    InvalidLayoutException
Get the Avro validation policy for a given column.

Parameters:
column - the column for which to get the Avro validation policy.
Returns:
the Avro validation policy for the given column.
Throws:
NoSuchColumnException - in case the column does not exist.
InvalidLayoutException - in case a fully qualified column in a map family is specified.

normalizeTableLayoutDesc

public TableLayoutDesc normalizeTableLayoutDesc(TableLayoutDesc desc,
                                                TableLayoutBuilder.LayoutOptions options)
                                         throws IOException
Normalizes a table layout descriptor to use schema UIDs only.

Parameters:
desc - Table layout descriptor to normalize.
options - Options describing the normalization to apply.
Returns:
the normalized table layout descriptor.
Throws:
IOException - on I/O error.
